Package com.terracottatech.store.configuration

Interface PersistentStorageType

All Known Implementing Classes:
PersistentStorageEngine
public interface PersistentStorageType
Persistent Storage engine type configured for a given dataset along with its attributes.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static PersistentStorageType
    defaultEngine()
    System wide default persistent storage engine type used, if none is specified for a dataset.
    ProductFeatureStatus
    getEngineStatus()
    Returns the status of the current feature support for this particular persistent storage engine.
    String
    getLongName()
    Returns a display name for this persistent storage type that cen be used for logging etc.
    int
    getPermanentId()
    Returns a permanent identifier for this persistent storage type that is guaranteed to stay unique, regardless of all the new persistent storage type(s) that may be added in the future.
    String
    getShortName()
    Returns a case insensitive name for this persistent storage type that can be used for configuration etc.
    static PersistentStorageType
    permanentIdToStorageType(int storageId)
     
    static PersistentStorageType
    shortNameToType(String name)

  • Method Details

    • getLongName

      String getLongName()
      Returns a display name for this persistent storage type that cen be used for logging etc.
      Returns:
      a display name

    • getShortName

      String getShortName()
      Returns a case insensitive name for this persistent storage type that can be used for configuration etc.
      Returns:
      a short name that can be used to match with config, if any

    • getEngineStatus

      ProductFeatureStatus getEngineStatus()
      Returns the status of the current feature support for this particular persistent storage engine.
      Returns:
      status of this product feature

    • getPermanentId

      int getPermanentId()
      Returns a permanent identifier for this persistent storage type that is guaranteed to stay unique, regardless of all the new persistent storage type(s) that may be added in the future.
      Returns:
      a permanent identifier for this persistent storage type

    • defaultEngine

      System wide default persistent storage engine type used, if none is specified for a dataset.
